ALLEGATION:
On 6/20/22, two youth were writing with chalk on the driveway of facility. One youth
wrote an inappropriate word and a staff member started calling the non-offending
youth derogatory names. Youth then attempted to throw a shoe at staff member's
head and was restrained as a result.
INVESTIGATION:
Complainant was contacted via email on July 6, 2022, and reported they had no
further information.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 6, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Administrator reported Staff 5 was terminated
from the facility on June 22, 2022, after the facility completed an internal
investigation. Administrator stated Staff 5 was taunting Youth A and his behavior
was inappropriate. Administrator was aware of Youth A and Youth B getting into a
fight and stated the incident was documented.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 6, 2022, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported she never worked with Staff 5.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 6, 2022, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported while walking back to her house she stopped
at a different house on campus and used their sidewalk chalk. Youth A stated Staff
5 told her to keep walking to her house. Youth A stated Staff 5 was laughing at her,
calling her a “bitch and acting like an immature child.” Youth A described Staff 5
opening and closing the door of the house and yelling out to her, “do something.”
Youth A stated she asked Staff 5 if she could talk with Staff 3, Youth A’s mentor, and
Staff 5 told her no and to return to her house. Youth A reported Staff 5 said, “don’t
fuck with me little ass bitch.” Youth A reported Staff 5 came out of the house, and
she threw a shoe at him, she missed, and Staff 5 laughed at her. Youth A stated
she went to hit Staff 5 and he placed her in a restraint. Youth A reported he had her
right arm all the way back and kept pulling tighter and tighter until she cried. Youth
3

A stated Staff 3 came out of the house and switched out Staff 5. Youth A reported
when Staff 5 let her go and got up to leave he turn and “smirked” at her.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7, 2022, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described walking with Youth A and Youth C when the
youth stopped at a house on campus to use the sidewalk chalk. Staff 2 stated Staff
5 yelled out the door for Youth A and Youth C to stop and continue to their house.
Staff 2 reported Youth A yelled back at Staff 5. Staff 2 described Staff 5 as
antagonizing Youth A by laughing at her and saying, “what you going to do about it?”
Staff 2 reported she was on the phone with Supervisor telling him what was taking
place. Staff 2 stated Staff 5 came out of the house and Youth A threw shoes at him.
Staff 2 reported Staff 5 placed Youth A in a restraint, Youth A dropped to the ground,
so Staff 5 went to a kneeling position. Staff 2 stated Staff 3 then came out of the
house and switched out Staff 5. Staff 2 described hearing Youth A say, “you’re
hurting me” while Staff 5 was holding her arms. Staff 2 stated when Staff 5 was
switched out and stood up he smiled at Youth A. Staff 2 stated she felt it was a
“control thing by Staff 5.” Staff 2 reported she could not remember if Staff 5 said
anything to Youth A. Staff 2 stated she felt the restraint Staff 5 did on Youth A was
“aggressive” and it looked like Staff 5 continued to pull Youth A’s arms further and
further together. Staff 2 reported she may have worked one shift with Staff 5 in the
past and does not really see him. Staff 2 reported Staff 5 pulled her to the side a
few days later and told her he was not going to let someone mess with him like that.
Youth C was attempted to be interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7, 2022,
at two separate times with DHHS Worker. Youth C refused to be interviewed.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7, 2022, and July 13,
2022, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Therapist reported Youth A shared with
her Staff 5 was yelling and swearing at her. Therapist stated in court Youth A
reported Staff 5 called her a “bitch”.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7, 2022, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. Youth D described Youth A and Youth B stopping at the house
and using chalk to write on the driveway. Youth D stated Staff 5 told them to not do
that and then said to Youth D, “you’re more mature then these 17-year-old kids.”
Youth D reported Staff 5 went outside, and Youth A hit him with a shoe, so he
placed her in a hold for five seconds. Youth D stated Staff 3 switched out Staff 5
from the restraint. Youth D denied hearing Staff 5 swear and stated he did not see
anything “improper” with the restraint. Youth D denied ever hearing Staff 5 swear at
youth, do a restraint that was improper or have any concerns with Staff 5.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 13, 2022, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 described Staff 5 telling Youth A and Youth C to put the
chalk down and walk away. Staff 3 stated Youth A yelled back and balled her fists
and Staff 5 said, “What are you going to do about it?” Staff 3 stated Staff 5 said this
about four or five times while opening and closing the door to the house. Staff 3
4

reported Staff 5 walked out of the house to assist in a different situation and Youth A
slapped the back of Staff 5’s head. Staff 3 stated Staff 5 placed Youth A in a
restraint with both of her hands behind her back. Staff 3 described Youth A lifting off
the ground, falling to the ground and Staff 5 moving to a seated restraint. Staff 3
stated she went outside, told Staff 5, “no I got this” and he released Youth A. Staff 3
stated as Staff 5 stood up he said, “that’s why you don’t fuck with me.” Staff 3
reported she did not recall Staff 5 calling Youth A a “bitch”. Staff 3 reported Staff 5
will sometimes swear at the youth if they are getting too rambunctious. Staff 3
stated Youth A was crying and screaming that she was in pain during the restraint.
Staff 3 stated the restraint was not done properly.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 13, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor reported he received a call from Staff 2
narrating the situation between Staff 5 and Youth A. Supervisor stated he could
hear Staff 5 tell Staff 2 to, “get her fucking kid” seven to eight times. Supervisor
denied hearing Staff 5 say “what you going to do?” Supervisor stated Staff 2 ended
the call when Staff 5 placed Youth A in the restraint. Supervisor reported that was
the first time he heard Staff 5 talk like that and never had any staff or youth bring up
concerns about Staff 5 swearing or being too aggressive during a restraint.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 13, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Supervisor 2 reported talking with staff and youth
involved in the incident to complete an internal investigation. Supervisor 2 stated
Staff 5’s behavior is not what is taught for behavior management.
Two messages were left with Staff 5 on July 14, 2022. Administrator 2 left
messages with Staff 5 on July 18, 2022, and July 19, 2022. DHHS Worker and I
went to Staff 5’s home on July 21, 2022, no one answered the door.
DHHS Worker has no findings in the investigation.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
 Michigan Department of Health and Human Services Incident Report
138000194, consistent with staff and youth interviews.
 Staff 5’s personnel file: Eagle Village Termination Form dated June 22, 2022.
 Resident Grievance Form completed by Youth A dated 06/20/22, consistent
with Youth A and staff interviews.
 Spectrum Health Big Rapids Hospital Walk In Clinic for Youth A dated
06/21/22. “Physical exam reveals swelling over the right thoracic back region
with tenderness palpation of the paraspinous muscles throughout the cervical
and thoracic regions. X-ray evaluation does not reveal any bony pathology at
this time.”
5

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 5 antagonied
Youth A. Staff 5 was said to be laughing at Youth A and
swearing at other staff about Youth A. The facility completed an
internal investigation upon hearing of the concerns and
terminated Staff 5 on June 22, 2022.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
A week ago, youth was assaulted by another youth, and it is not believed that this
was documented.
INVESTIGATION:
Complainant was contacted via email on July 6, 2022, and reported they had no
further information.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 6, 2022, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Administrator was aware of Youth A and Youth B
getting into a fight and stated the incident was documented.
Staff 1 stated Youth A kept telling her peers to stop talking about Staff 5. Staff 1
reported Youth B asked Youth A if she was talking about her then went over to her
and the two youth began to pull each other’s hair and punched one another. Staff 1
stated she intervened immediately as well as Staff 4. Staff 1 stated Youth A and
Youth B had each other’s hair, so it was difficult to separate them. Staff 1 reported
Staff 6 was in the bathroom and when she came out called for extra staff and
assisted right away. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B did not have prior issues
with one another, and the incident happened quickly. Staff 1 reported the incident
was documented on an incident report.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 6, 2022, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. Youth A described talking with staff when Youth B came over
and punched her in the face and started pulling her hair. Youth A stated she went
after Youth B. Youth A reported staff did not do anything, it took 20 minutes for staff
to intervene. Youth A described Staff 4 holding her back and Staff 1 holding Youth B
while Staff 6 stayed with the rest of the youth. Youth A stated staff struggled to
separate them because both girls had each other’s hair.
6

Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7, 2022, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. Youth B acknowledged she had been in a fight with Youth A.
Youth B stated staff intervened right away and separated them. Youth B reported
she felt it was a quick response by staff to break up the fight.
Youth C was attempted to be interviewed face to face at the facility on July 7, 2022,
at two separate times with DHHS Worker. Youth C refused to be interviewed.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 13, 2022, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 reported he was in the office when he heard some
commotion. Staff 4 stated he ran out of the office to assist and saw Staff 1 standing
between Youth A and Youth B. Staff 4 reported he assisted in breaking up the fight,
but the youths had each other’s hair, so it was difficult to separate them. Staff 4
stated Staff 6 was in the restroom but came out right away to help. Staff 4 described
staff handling the situation very quickly. Staff 4 stated he completed an incident
report.
Staff 6 was interviewed via Teams on July 26, 2022, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. Staff 6 stated she came out of the bathroom and Youth A and Youth B
were being held back from one another by staff. Staff 6 described Youth B having
Youth A’s hair in her hand and Staff 6 worked to have Youth B release Youth A’s
hair. Staff 6 stated Staff 1 and Staff 4 were the staff separating the youth.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
 Eagle Village Incident Reports for Youth A and Youth B dated 06/29/2022.
Youth A and Youth B engage in a physical altercation, staff immediately
responded, and incident was documented, consistent with staff and youth
interviews.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program Statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written
program statement which specifically addresses all of the
following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission,
care, safety, and supervision, methods for addressing
residents’ needs, implementation of treatment plans, and
discharge of residents.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in compliance as an incident report was
completed describing the fight between Youth A and Youth B.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan no change be
made to the license status of this child caring institution.
